docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 7 (U.P.)--Employes of the National Fuel Administration agreed at a meeting today to return to work Monday, ending an eighteen-day strike. The workers accepted a settlement stipulating they would not be penalized for striking...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 7 (U.P.)--Employes of the National Fuel Administration agreed at a meeting today to return to work Monday, ending an eighteen-day strike. The workers accepted a settlement stipulating they would not be penalized for striking and that their demands would be negotiated immediately.
docs.abstract: Fuel Adm strike ties up Montevideo

headline.main: SHIPPING--MAILS; ALL HOURS GIVEN IN DAYLIGHT SAVING TIME

docs.snippet: Almost every commodity lost ground yesterday in New York futures trading. The exceptions were copper, lead, zinc and hides, which were not traded, and wool, which shot up the limit on a good demand.
docs.lead_paragraph: Almost every commodity lost ground yesterday in New York futures trading. The exceptions were copper, lead, zinc and hides, which were not traded, and wool, which shot up the limit on a good demand.
